185952128.review:
Wolfenstein II es la secuela del conocido shooter en primera persona ambientado en una distopía en la que los alemanes ganaron la II Guerra Mundial.

La historia está centrada en la resistencia americana y en el inicio de una revolución contra la ocupación alemana. En términos de guión, el juego es bastante simple y emula a su predecesor en su inicio y final.

A nivel de personajes, la historia recicla buena parte de los anteriores y añade algunas novedades. El protagonista es el mismo y no tiene ninguna evolución.

Respecto a los diálogos, destacar que son horribles, especialmente las conversaciones introspectivas del protagonista. Con las cinemáticas ocurre algo parecido, se hacen largas y dan ganas de pasarlas por no tener que aguantar el suplicio verbal de los personajes. Otro punto negativo a este respecto es el humor. Aparece en muy pocas ocasiones pero cuando lo hace te saca completamente del juego, está completamente fuera de lugar y es ajeno al tono de la mayor parte del juego.

A nivel de gráficos el juego cumple apropiadamente. Los modelos de los personajes son correctos y dado que la mayor parte de los enemigos tienen casco (o duran muy poco en pantalla) tampoco se aprecia mucho bajón en personajes menos importantes.

Respecto a los escenarios y el diseño de niveles, decir que son poco imaginativos y mediocres. Mención aparte el submarino y su incomprensible diseño.

Las armas son cumplidoras y no hay ninguna novedad potente o algo que destaque sobre el resto que le aporte algo especial al gameplay. La personalización es cortita y salvo algunos detalles interesantes no hay mucha creatividad. Anodino en general.

Por otro lado, el juego cuenta con un sistema de progresión interesante (calcado del anterior) que aporta un cierto grado de personalización a la hora de jugar y de como avanzar en el juego dado que se permite que cada jugador progrese de manera distinta dependiendo de las estrategias que más explote.

La duración es correcta y para la historia que desarrolla tampoco se le pide más. Quizás la parte que pueda alargar más la experiencia son los coleccionables.

Los coleccionables son una plaga en el juego y abundan en diferentes tipos restándole calidad a la experiencia dada la ubicuidad y sobrecarga de los mismos.

La dificultad es muy configurable, el modo normal puede resultar extremadamente sencillo en algunos momentos, aunque de vez en cuando aflora algún pico dificultad pero sin mayor importancia.

Respecto a los DLC decir que no merecen especialmente la pena, hay tres capítulos con tres misiones y luego un capítulo 0 que sirve de tráiler para la experiencia del DLC. 

Cada capítulo tiene como protagonista a un personaje distinto y nuevo. Este protagonista se enfoca en unas habilidades determinadas, aunque solo el 2 tiene un mayor impacto en la forma de jugar. En cuanto a historia, ninguno merece la pena, quizás el 3 puede ser algo más pasable.

En conclusión, Wolfenstein II es una secuela mediocre de un juego mucho mejor. El apartado de los diálogos es profundamente negativo y solo merece la pena la experiencia por el propio gameplay que hereda de su predecesor.

Y es que el gameplay es divertido, pero también hay que tener en cuenta que los escenarios son peores y en general la calidad del juego se ha visto resentida en muchos aspectos comparativamente.

Recomendado para pasar el rato pero no deja de ser un bajón fuerte en la saga.

characters
plot lines

Nothing in this game was an improvement and so much was a misstep. Why does the laser just remove set areas now?
Why was the use of the laser almost 99% not pushed. I just didn't use it and nothing made me use it which is pretty shoddy.
Why was there no end boss? Why did plot points just get delivered with no lead up? "hey we're going to Area 52" "oh we're here" "hey btw its on venus" "oh im here" That shit was ass. Whole game is ass. Had more fun playing Old Blood and that story was mega ass.

If New Order is Goodfellas, This game is Casino. A big overinflated overdone hype fest that is in love with itself so much that it doesn't realize its previous project was cool because what was in it was cool, not that everything was made with being cool as the central focus.

This game has an ego and tries too hard to be impactful, funny, and serious and overall comes off as a disjointed clown show with next to no impact whatsoever.

My review for New Order is one word.  "Elite."
It had moments, weapons, and plot points that made my jaw drop many times throughout.
When Frau Engel gets her jaw broken by a robot in New Order and grabs you and comes into frame it is as if you are in VR and its quite a shock.

All in all fuck this game. It's boring and is a terrible sequel to which i will probably blot out its story as canon to New Order.

185775763.review:
The New Order - 3/5
The New Colossus: 3.5/5, best story
The Old Blood - 3.5/5, best gameplay
Play order recommendation: TNO -> TNC -> TOB

The New Colossus' (TNC) most important contribution to the new Wolfenstein saga is its story. It fleshes out TNO's shallow characters and dives deep into the themes introduced in the first game. TNC has many incredible non-gameplay scenes such as the Blaskowicz home and Hitler's audition which feel like they're taken straight out of movies. Some complain that the story became "woke," but its always been about minorities killing fascists. TNC just amps it up. If you don't mind a magnifying glass being brought onto America and its troubled history of both good and evil, then you'll enjoy what TNC's story has to offer.

Now, for gameplay, TNC takes a baffling step backwards from TOB and even TNO in its gunplay. You can dual-wield any combination of firearms, but the system for switching weapons is so obtuse that if you want to switch your combo, you'll have to first UN-dual-wield, switch to a new weapon, RE-dual-wield, and then switch your right hand weapon. This is compounded by the fact that Machine Games decided to slow the weapon switch speed to a snail's pace despite buffing movement speed. What results is getting turned into swiss cheese by your enemies as you try to fumble with your dual-wields.

TNC also regresses in its enemy variety, not because there aren't any new enemies, but because all of them are defeated the same way. Keep a long range assault rifle and a short range shotgun as your dual-wields and you'd be hard-pressed to switch out for anything other than a two-handed power weapon. Enemies no longer have weak spots which demand certain strategies from the player (flanking heavy enemies in TNO and sniping fuel-tanks in TOB); everything in TNC is effectively killed by the same meta dual-wield combos and power weapons.

It's not terrible, shooting Nazis with dual-wielded weapons is always fun, but I hope that Machine Games decide to evolve the gameplay of TOB rather than TNC for Wolfenstein 3.

185591488.review:
Plutôt un bon Wolfenstein qui corrige pas mal de défaut que pouvait avoir New Order.

Les robots, ou mecha nazis, sont tuables avec des armes standard, j'ai mis en normal, je ne veux aucunement jouer en mode furtif, je n'aime absolument pas ça.  Là où même en mode normal New Order était casse pieds car il fallait absolument détruire les robots avec des grenades pour les stun.

Les armes sont suffisamment fun et puissante pour varier les plaisir, surtout les grosses armes jetable ou tourelle. Si il n'y avait pas ça, je me serais ennuyé beaucoup, car tuer de l'humain c'est pas mon truc ça me lasse, mais de temps en temps... pourquoi pas.

Toutes les armes ont trois améliorations qui la plupart du temps vont donner un tir secondaire, un plus gros chargeur et etc... c'est très sympa. Il n'y a pas d'ordre suffit de trouver des kits d'amélioration. Les grosses armes jetables dont une arme de l’arsenal seront à recharger à certains point dans les maps, fuel ou batteries, un mauvais point dans New Order et c'est toujours un mauvais point ici mais moins gênant.

Les gadgets en revanche j'ai trouvé ça assez naze et ridicule... le bélier, qui te permet de foncer/renverser des nazis et péter des murs, même en voulant le faire les nazis auront largement le temps de te buter avant que t'arrives au contact, même en normal..

Les échasses c'est bien mais tu es lent une fois en hauteur, ça permet en revanche d'atteindre plus facilement certaines zones en hauteur, mais encore faut il connaitre les maps et savoir où l'utiliser.

Le Constrictor est totalement pour l'infiltration, tu te faufiles dans des espaces exiguë, ne provoque aucun bruit de pas etc... 

Comme dans le premier il y a des chefs nazis à buter, si on les bute silencieusement, ils ne pourront pas appeler de renforts, et c'est la plupart du temps mal foutu de jouer fufu car il m'est arrivé de débarquer dans une map et paf à peine 2 secondes arrivé, je me suis mis à marcher que j'étais déjà repéré... J'ai vraiment AUCUNE envie de jouer furtif, la plupart du temps j'ai buté les chef nazis en alertant toute la terre entière, au dessus du mode normal ne faites pas ça, ce sera un supplice.
Par contre les chef nazis drop une sorte de code, un code enigma, qu'il faudra résoudre dans la base à partir d'un certains moment dans le jeu, et ces codes donnent la positions d'autres chef nazis à buter. C'est bien mais on rencontre trop peu de chef, et si comme moi on a échoué à comprendre comment résoudre le code Enigma, si on échoue le nombre de codes nécessaire vont diminuer.. 
Du coup, une fois finis le jeu, il faudra tuer du nazis en boucle sans but, sans objectifs, sans nouvelles armes, sans nouvelles améliorations etc... vue qu'on a déjà tous, pour drop des codes énigma... et bien non, pas de récompenses, ça ne motive pas du tout à refaire des zones déjà faites.

Sinon certains moment de l'histoire sont totalement débiles et touchant par moment, la VF de BJ Blazkowicz a changé rapport à The New Order le jeu d'avant, c'est dommage, c'est la voix de feu Patrick Poivey qui est dans celui là.

[spoiler]Mode histoire qui part totalement en cacahuète ah ah ,c'était marrant, on voit papy Hitler dans sa forteresse, on doit se déguisé à un moment, il prends un seau et pisse dedans, vomis sur la moquette, se met allonger tranquille pour parler devant tout le monde le tout en robe de chambre 😂  , bute sans prise de tête ses gardes, ses associés, mais bordel qu'on l'achève XD (et on peut le buter :p ) , et autre moment bien débile c'est le moment du coupage de tête, oui on se fait couper la tête mais on survit grâce à un corps de super soldat (qui m'a un peu fait repensé au decoupage de corps dans Quake 4) ...[/Spoiler] enfin bref du WTF de bonne facture

185405012.review:
Solid shooter that builds on well-established mechanics in new settings and against new enemies. Extremely visceral effects + sounds: TNO and Old Blood bring some of the most satisfying kills on armored infantry in the entire FPS genre, and Wolf II is also blessed with great feeling kills. 

Higher difficulties are not perfect, it runs into the same issues as high difficulty CoD where you get wasted by a singular enemy hiding in an awkward dark spot, but still rewarding. Very strong creative direction, you'll get an unlimited stream of monsters, machines, unique landscapes and sci-fi presentations rendered in the highest quality of its era (to say nothing of the delicious cassette-core interiors of the Venus base).

Where the rest of the reboot series took place in fairly consistent levels, Wolf II decides for for variety and novelty.  It's rich, concentrated, and varied here. Where it lacks the poetry and soul of TNO's writing, it compensates with visual splendor, and I find myself wanting to return to Wolf II more often than the rest of the series because an image will pop into my head. Like future mechas defending the bombed out base of a Manhattan skyscraper, or leering in at unaware Nazi commanders through reinforced glass windows on Venus to plan my stealth attack once inside. It sticks with you. 

There is one crowning flaw, which is the needle drop choice at the end credits, like a chunk of coal on top of an ice cream sundae. Great game, but that song... Also, they never made any good DLC for it. Regularly goes on sale for $6 USD.

185258299.review:
Wolfenstein: The New Colossus — это потрясающая игра, которая переносит вас в альтернативную реальность, где нацисты победили во Второй мировой войне. Графика впечатляет, а сюжет захватывает с первых минут. Главный герой, Б.J. Blazkowicz, возвращается с новыми силами, чтобы сразиться с злом и освободить Америку от угнетателей.

Геймплей разнообразен и динамичен, с отличной механикой стрельбы и множеством способов подхода к каждому заданию. Игра предлагает интересные побочные квесты и глубокое развитие персонажей, что делает ее еще более увлекательной. Ощущение, что каждое ваше действие имеет значение, добавляет игре глубины.

Музыка и звук создают атмосферу, погружающую в мир непрекращающейся борьбы. Если вы ищете качественный шутер с продуманным сюжетом и яркими персонажами, Wolfenstein: The New Colossus определенно стоит вашего времени. Рекомендую!

I enjoyed it but ffs do not buy it for over $10 CAD the main story is 8-11 hours long depending on whether you include cut scenes and how long it takes you to find the random point of egress to the next level. 

Feel the game minus cut scenes could be as short as 5 hours for lucky player. My guess is that it was targeted to people who wanted to bash their head against a wall for hours trying to perfect some insane difficulty level; but I have other games I want to play. 

Maybe if I was 7 and my parents bought me one game a year and somehow let me play this game I'd do that but with endless choices making difficulty the only replayable feature doesn't work like it did when I played Wolfenstien in DOS. 

My general preference is $1 of enjoyable game play per hour or less so take it with a grain of salt.

Overall fun vivid characters although a little trite; the world was well built and the alt history lore litter was enjoyable. Story was good to great until it was cut short; just wish they expanded on it and I felt they could have done so without new maps like side quests as alternative objectives (enigma). 

If you get it on the cheap and like alternate history and or FPS there are a few good moments you'll enjoy. 

To the developers: Fallout style Wolfenstein would be a great world to explore. I want to play man in the high castle and this is the franchise that could do it.

185168821.review:
I wanted to like this game. I really did. But I actually kind of hate it. I'm fresh from the credits and i'm in such a goddamn bad mood.

I spun the wheel, it chose this. I played it for 10 hours and finished it... What a fucking sedative. This game is like booze. It starts putting you to sleep, then you wake up with a fucking headache.

Walking around the submarine sucks. Dealing with bullet sponge enemies and running out of ammo all the time sucks. Having to spam E for armour and health sucks. Picking up a gun you don't want to hold from amidst the ammo and armour sucks. Being stuck at 50 health for half the game sucks. Spamming the hint button because I don't know where the hint even is sucks. Missing tiny pathways that continue the game sucks.

Fuck the courthouse level, the oberkommand? and the ship fight before the ending the most. On the last one I just fucking gave up and switched to the easiest difficulty because I was genuinely convinced the final boss enemies were bugged and not taking damage. 

I played on NORMAL, and it's honestly a joke. Melee an enemy with one (1) other enemy nearby? Dead. Take a heavy weapon off the mount? Dead. Spin up the laser-weapon a tad bit late? Dead. Enemy explodes close to you after killing them? Dead. Hit by a super-soldier's thrust? Dead. Run out of ammo for one gun then switch to another gun that has to be reloaded? Dead. Autosave spawned you in a shit position? Dead. Carrying a heavy weapon you need, but dropped it because a grenade knocked you or a dog bit you? Dead. Fuck up stealth while low on health? Restart, because otherwise, dead.

The gameplay is just... Eugh. That said though, I still like the world building. The cinematics, the music. the characters, the story. I do love all of it, it's just I load in, kill a bunch a nazis, and i'm not even having fun. I'm just bored and completing the game so my OCD doesn't bug me. Maybe i'll replay it later down the line on easy and change my mind. I don't have any shame admitting that. Normal is fucking stupid. Maybe there's something i'm missing that makes it tolerable. I only found like 2 gun upgrades in the whole fuckin thing so maybe they help? Don't know, don't care. 

... Eugh, fuck it. I'll change my opinion to a recommended. A good chunk of my issues and burnout come from me choosing to push through the difficulty. I do warn you though. Play it on fucking easy, honestly. The game mocks it as "Can I play, daddy?" or some shit. BUT BABIES HAVE IT RIGHT. BABIES DON'T PAY TAXES OR HAVE TO THINK. THEY JUST SUCK BREASTS AND SHIT THEMSELVES. THAT SOUNDS BETTER THAN WHATEVER THE HELL YOU OR I ARE DOING.

"You haven't been doing the exercises we agreed upon. You haven't been following your diet…And you said you would do your exercises and lay off the sugar...but what did my men find when they searched your room? Chocolate, cookies, lemonade, candy!”-General Irene Engel

Why does everyone think General Engel is a villain? Bunch of Mountain Dew addicts here. GO TO THE GYM! If she were your mom, you and your dad would be in the kitchen full time and not even worth a slap. Engel is a great role model for women. Every time I see her in this game series, I get butterflies in my stomach. Sickening how many people in these reviews are afraid of competent women. 

General Irene Engel is the soul of Wolfenstein and gives the game purpose and characterization of what the fight is about. This game was so politically woke, it didn’t even allow General Engel to be a boss, and made veteran fighters like Fergus and BJ to become cucks. Incomplete game and yet they make three subpar DLC storylines. You do not EVER bench your star players!  

The story writers messed up big time. When did Fergus and BJ become cucks? It’s the 1960s! 

What concept changes would I do if I was a writer?
Back in Wolfenstein New Order: Anya stays in the elevator with BJ trying to wake up BJ to get him to snap out of it after being injected with a tranquilizer by Bubi. Anya does not escape the elevator like everyone else does. Anya gets killed by Robot Fergus or Wyatt. 

Wolfenstein New Colossus:(We do not need to know BJ’s childhood backstory or any woke add-on characters. Delete it. We’ll see a background story cinematics of Sigrun and her mom, Engel. Keep the audition scenes on Venus) BJ and Engel both have seen their romantic partners killed and take their anger out on each other which ends up developing into a real sick and twisted romantic relationship. 

I believe this concept as a foundation would make a much more interesting story than what the writers wrote which became left wing pro-communism political propaganda. 

The gameplay: I love starting off in a wheel chair, like Joe from Family Guy. The game has good action moments like the court house, but needed more levels. Many existing levels like Venus seem to be concept copied from the New Order on the Moon. I would of loved to see interactive cinematic gameplay like the train scene in the New Order. The gameplay and controls are pretty good. The game lacks the number of bosses like other Wolfenstein games had. We only see giant robots that shoot rockets and have a flame thrower for nearby targets and the two more athletic robots at the end. They are really easy. The panzerhunds were less agile in this game than the others. The panzerhunds in New Order and Old Blood much more deadly. 

The soundtracks created by Mick Gordon are amazing and go great with the game. The songs like Schwarz-Rote Welle - Ich bin überall, part of the games Neumond Records really immerse you into the German culture. The letters you picked up in the New Order had German with English translation side by side which is great for language learners (really authentic). The New Colossus we do not get that side-by-side translation from the letter pickups. 

If the game was not really focused on cinematics, the story line wouldn’t really matter as much. I would recommend this game, but they incorporated a lot of story line and cinematics. I love Wolfenstein, but shame on the writers. I hate the ending to this game. I cannot recommend it. They need to remaster or change this because they benched and degraded the pivotal star characters. 

PS: I put gaming on a break and I lost over 50 lbs over a year going to the gym. I would pay the voice actress of General Engel to yell at me like that. She is “Magical” as A puts it in the letter. Bravo to Nina Franoszek!

184980649.review:
Having finished all three games, I genuinely liked New Colossus as a sequel to New Order, it gives some more depth and backstory to Blazkowicz, has some of the same gameplay mechanics slightly improved (although difficult can be a bit too extreme at times, I had to play a level lower than New Order/Old Blood to find it fun) and the aesthetic of the world is still pretty damn cool. 

However, I still found it a bit *too* short. I was so rooting for more that I didn't realize the ending credits were the ending credits and I was excited for a second thinking there was a whole other game past that, but it's likely my fault lol

Another odd thing was how the writing suffered (IMO) compared to New Order: Nazis on the Moon I can understand and accept, but on Venus? That's way too bonkers even for this universe. Here's my reasoning:

New Order had a bit of serious worldbuilding at some moments. Of course, Nazi winning the war is already unlikely, but New Order explained it by this ancient ultra tech made by Da'at Yichud (which is bonkers, but at that point I just went with it naturally). However, the historical what-ifs like the Allied D-Day failing and becoming a Nazi museum, the Manhattan Project's demise, the twisted rebuilt of London, the Gibraltar Bridge's construction, the presence of the Volkshalle... Anyone with a bit of casual knowledge about WWII can see these would be things that either amazed or shocked you.

There's something that I can't quite describe, but the overall vibe of it all. New Order was pretty bleak and hopeless, while this one despite having some pretty fucked up moments... Fails to achieve that somehow. Nazis are more comical than in NO, less intimidating, and it was that intimidating aspect that made you feel satisfaction in annihilating them out of your way.

You can feel the hate and frustration delivered by Blazko when he stabs the Nazi soldier in the asylum in New Order, but here it turns into silly current-culture-war speeches that feel forced - and I felt this was often the case. It's like the game is constantly having to remind the player that Nazis are bad through dialogue when New Order had you actually witnessing their monstruosity.

Besides all that, it's just nitpicking... Just wish there was more of Blazkowicz badassery.

184701640.review:
Compared to the first game, this sequel is worse in almost all aspects and a DNF for me.
TLDR: its a bad Metro: Exodus ripoff, just play Metro: Exodus.

The gameplay and upgrades feel better than the first game, but once its put into action in the combat and stealth just feel off and far less satisfying.
The level design and atmosphere are dull and lifeless compared to the first game and really just feel like lazy small 'boxes' you travel between rather than adventure in an overarching world as in the first game.
Most of the old characters are either become very unlikable or are quickly killed off to make room for the new characters.
All of the new characters are extremely unlikable and are incredibly poorly written. Its hard to immerse yourself into a hero story when the people you're trying to save spend most of the game talking down to you and have next to nothing redeemable about them.
I know this series is supposed to be campy (I've played 1 and the prequel) but this one makes all the villains so cartoony and poorly written that I found myself snorting at half the scenes that are supposed to shock you with their evil actions.

I eventually realised that this game is just a ripoff of Metro: Exodus that forgot to include the engaging characters, charm, visual storytelling, amazing locations, satisfying gameplay, and meaningful choices. The only thing it successfully copied was a likeable female main character that the main male character is devoted to.

184571660.review:
[h1] A week's walkthrough of the Wolfenstein series and the review of New Colossus.  [/h1]
This game is a sequel to [u] Wolfenstein: New Order [/u] and I can say it could be a decent end to the series, but the developers decided to release a part of [u] Youngblood [/u] (there will be a separate review about it).
If we talk about the second part, then the game has:
- nice graphics and great optimization
- good plot and continuation
- interesting and epic moments (Wolfenstein style)
- hardcore (for me this is a plus).
But if you compare it with the part of [u] New Order [/u], you can notice the following changes:
- there is more realism in this part.
- it is heavier (as I said above, this is a plus for me).
- contains "Mein Leben" difficulty. An interesting and difficult challenge that gives you one life for completing the game. You will die anywhere. Hah. Start over.
- a lot of additional content, namely (tasks, games, dialogues, etc.)
So, the game is interesting and a worthy continuation of the series, but if you haven't played the previous part, you should play New Order first and only then proceed to this part. 
For fans of shooters and hardcore, just the same.

184486707.review:
This game i have very complicated feelings on. i definitely think this is the best game so far but it has a few problems that still keep me from definitively fully recommending any game in the series because every game has its own set of problems which is really annoying but hey, game development is hard.

the biggest problem is the difficulty, most of the time its okay (played on hardest difficulty) with you stealthing around and thinning the heard of enemies before an inevitable firefight kicks off with enough room to just avoid and run past the enemies but there are some few sections in the game that feel completely unfair and required me to replay it a few dozen times to get past. some parts of the game force you into combat with very little cover in large open environments and these universally suck complete ass. the perfect example of this is the notorious courtroom fight which has gone down in history as being one of the most difficult sections in modern gaming. I HAD to turn the difficulty down for that part as its around 10 straight minutes of running around and clearing waves of bad guys with very little health in a big open room with destructible cover, you are not ashamed from just skipping that part.

there are i'd say around 4 sections in the game like that where you don't have the decision of fighting, sneaking or running past enemies and the game just forces you to fight in a way that undermines the balance of mechanics and game states the game was going for, this game is at its worst when its just a standard shooter.

that and I occasionally got lost finding where to go because all the levels are so dark and murky I couldn't auctually see in front of me and everything looked the same, that's another thing that bothers me is that it looks worse then the old blood and the new order while also looking better.


wow this game sounds like it sucks right? occasionally annoying combat, difficulty spikes and bad looking hard to navigate levels, surely nothing could justify that.

no, this game is actually still very good. this game has really good pacing and conveyance in the story. the characters are all really well written and the cutscenes are great. the game is full of great moments in gameplay and in story, the best this series has ever been.

but like every machinegames... game, it falls apart at the end with a pretty bad bullet spongy boss fight with 2 big robots, the setting and music of the fight was pretty cool though. and the game ends kinda strangely? ... I sort of felt like the last hour of this game was just a trailer for Wolfenstein 3 which MIGHT be in development right now I don't know

anyway this game is a mixed bag but most of the bag is pretty yummy, some stuff in the bag you can just not eat and skip, bag contains a bunch of great character moments, great music and story. this analogy dosent work oruisghosirj.

8/10 - Your as tough as they come you know, jesus christ.

184446358.review: Comptez une bonne soixantaine d'heures pour terminer à 100% ce Wolfenstein. Il reprend là où New Order s'est terminé, avec cette fois-ci un QG et une équipe de résistants plus importante. Les missions apportent du renouveau, avec des accessoires permettant de casser des murs, se mettre sur échasses, ou encore de passer de fins conduits d'aération. Le gameplay est intéressant, même si comme dans son prédécesseur, il faudra jouer de discrétion dans les difficultés les plus élevées pour éviter de mourir. Les DLC apportent un vrai plus, avec trois nouveaux scénarios et des personnages qui reprennent les capacités de Blazko. Malgré ça, les défis sont très difficiles et sont plus du rajout de temps de jeu qu'un réel challenge divertissant.

Jogabilidade e Desafio - jogabilidade e bem redondinha com boa variedade de armas e com infinidade de inimigos distintos com bom desafio com inimigos muito inteligentes que flanqueam pegam cover e raramente atacam sem pensar ,apesar de ter partes mais cascudas e nao vi nenhuma parte injusta ou com dificuldade artificial e muito equilibrada nesse quesito.

Resumo - gameplay divertida e diversificada com bons graficos porem com historia rasa e com novos personagens bem questionaveis.

184253443.review:
Évaluation : 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 (5/5)
"Un tour de force narratif et un gameplay explosif, Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus est un jeu d'action incontournable."

Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus, développé par MachineGames, est un jeu qui ne laisse personne indifférent. Suite directe de Wolfenstein: The New Order, ce titre continue l'histoire de BJ Blazkowicz dans un monde alternatif où le Troisième Reich a remporté la Seconde Guerre mondiale. Avec un mélange explosif de gameplay frénétique, de narration poignante et de personnages mémorables, ce jeu offre une expérience immersive qui vous tiendra en haleine du début à la fin.

Les Points Forts :
✅ Un scénario audacieux et émotionnel : Ce qui distingue Wolfenstein II des autres jeux de tir à la première personne, c'est sa capacité à lier une action intense à une narration profonde. Le jeu aborde des thèmes lourds comme la résistance face à l'oppression, la famille, la rédemption et le sacrifice. Le personnage de BJ Blazkowicz, en particulier, est profondément humain et complexe, bien loin du simple héros invincible. L’histoire est captivante, souvent surprenante, et fait écho à des événements historiques tout en restant parfaitement ancrée dans son univers alternatif.
✅ Gameplay incroyablement fun et dynamique : Le gameplay de Wolfenstein II est tout simplement un régal. Vous êtes constamment en mouvement, affrontant des vagues d'ennemis dans des combats intenses et rapides. Le jeu offre une grande variété d'armes, chacune ayant son propre style et son efficacité dans des situations spécifiques. Le choix entre un style de jeu furtif ou plus bourrin est particulièrement bien équilibré, avec des mécanismes qui favorisent les deux approches. L’action frénétique et les animations de mort spectaculaires rendent chaque fusillade excitante.
✅ Graphismes et direction artistique impressionnants : Le jeu est visuellement superbe, avec des environnements variés et détaillés qui donnent vie à ce monde dystopique. Les textures, les effets de lumière et les animations sont de haute qualité, et les designs des ennemis, notamment les nazis cybernétiques et les boss, sont mémorables et impressionnants. Les scènes d’action sont magnifiquement chorégraphiées, et la direction artistique du jeu contribue grandement à l’immersion.
✅ Personnages mémorables et dialogues brillants : L’un des atouts majeurs de Wolfenstein II réside dans ses personnages. BJ Blazkowicz est un protagoniste brut mais attachant, et les alliés que vous rencontrez, comme Anya, Caroline, et Set, sont tous bien écrits et apportent une dimension émotionnelle au jeu. Les dialogues sont percutants et souvent poignants, apportant de la profondeur à l’histoire tout en allégeant les moments d’intensité par de l’humour noir bien placé.
✅ Musiques et sonorités marquantes : La bande-son de Wolfenstein II est un véritable atout, mélangeant des morceaux rock et des airs dramatiques pour accompagner parfaitement l’action et l’histoire. La musique accentue l’intensité des combats et la gravité des moments clés de la narration. De plus, les bruitages des armes, des explosions et des dialogues contribuent à l’immersion, rendant l'expérience encore plus intense.
✅ Niveaux bien conçus et variés : Le jeu propose une grande variété de niveaux, allant de la résistance dans des villes américaines envahies par les nazis à des missions secrètes dans des installations futuristes. Chaque niveau offre de nouveaux défis, des ennemis uniques et des secrets à découvrir. L’exploration est encouragée, et les environnements sont remplis de détails et d'objets à collectionner qui ajoutent à la profondeur du jeu.

Les Points Faibles :
⚠️ Une courbe de difficulté parfois un peu inégale : Bien que le jeu offre plusieurs niveaux de difficulté, certains joueurs pourraient trouver la transition entre certains chapitres trop abrupte, avec des pics de difficulté qui peuvent rendre certaines sections frustrantes, notamment contre les boss ou dans les zones à forte densité d’ennemis. Cela peut briser le rythme pour ceux qui recherchent une expérience plus fluide.
⚠️ Certains moments peuvent sembler répétitifs : Bien que le gameplay soit excitant, les missions peuvent parfois paraître un peu répétitives, surtout si vous vous engagez dans un style de jeu plus bourrin. La variété des ennemis et des environnements ne suffit pas toujours à compenser un peu de redondance dans les objectifs ou les types de combats, en particulier dans la deuxième moitié du jeu.
⚠️ Manque de mode multijoueur ou contenu coopératif : Un petit reproche que l’on pourrait faire à Wolfenstein II est l'absence de mode multijoueur ou coopératif. Bien que le jeu se concentre sur une expérience solo intense, certains joueurs pourraient apprécier un mode compétitif ou coopératif pour prolonger la durée de vie du jeu et diversifier les expériences de gameplay.

En conclusion :
Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus est un jeu qui combine à la perfection une action frénétique et une narration profonde. Le gameplay est explosif et amusant, tandis que l’histoire et les personnages vous tiennent en haleine du début à la fin. La direction artistique est brillante, et la bande-son vous immerge complètement dans cette dystopie. Malgré quelques petites imperfections, notamment dans la difficulté et la répétitivité de certaines sections, Wolfenstein II est un jeu incontournable pour les fans de FPS et ceux qui recherchent une expérience à la fois intense et émotive.

⏳ Temps de jeu recommandé : 12-15 heures pour la campagne principale, plus si vous souhaitez explorer tous les secrets du jeu et débloquer toutes les améliorations.
🎮 Verdict final : Un jeu d’action de qualité supérieure, avec un scénario audacieux et des mécaniques de gameplay ultra satisfaisantes. Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus est une aventure palpitante, à la fois brutale et poignante, qui vous marquera longtemps après l'avoir terminé.

184185131.review:
[h1][b]Обзор Длинною в жизнь: Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus [/b][/h1]

Всем доброго времени суток. Сегодня у меня наконец дошли руки до этого шедевра игровой индустрии. Я честно говоря, долго думал писать обзор на эту игру или нет, мне просто нечего было сказать. Были пару моментов, которые можно озвучить и все. Но я думаю стоит хотя бы попытаться изложить свои мысли и в общем поговорить об игре. 

[h1][b]Завязка[/b][/h1]
Wolfenstein игра с тематикой альтернативного исхода второй мировой, где нацисты победили, и захватили всю планету. Игра продолжает события после предыдущей части. Бласковиц находясь в предсмертной агонии, видит флешбеки из детства, параллельно его кишки собирают товарищи из прошлой части. После какого то времени, мы уже почти целы, почти здоровы, но на подлодку напали фашисты, и мы садимся на коляску правосудия, и идем по захваченной подлодке. По итогу подымаемся на мачту, видем как фрицы схватили Кэролайн,
и просят нашу тушу в обмен на ее и (Вайта или Фергуса). Требованием за обмен являемся мы, так что Бласковиц не ожидая пошел договариваться. По итогу мы в плену, оказывается Фрау Энгель  выжила( я думал она умерла...), и теперь имеет красивый шрам на пол лица. Ну и ладно. После не приятных пыток, ребята высвобождаются благодаря Дочери Фрау Энгель , и теперь она становиться нашим сообщником. По итогу ребята сбегают, и начинают обсуждать дальнейшии планы…. 
 в которых нас ждут, полеты на Марс, возможно марсианки с 3мя парами сисек. Захват бункера, гоп стоп дережабля, перестрелки с голыми женщинами, робо собаки, огромные хуевины, и многое другое ...

[h1][b]Про персонажей[/b][/h1]
Мне очень понравился подход к Бласковицу. Порой играя в игру, мы слышим его мысли, и что он думает. Так же есть миссия в которой мы приезжаем в дом где раньше жил герой, и там видим флешбеки. Что тоже круто раскрывает персонажа. В прошлых частях такого не было(Как я помню) и очень приятно, от этих моментов намного легче сочувствовать и скажем так, почувствовать себя в шкуре Бласковица...Единственное, что меня пол игры злила Грейс… Ну типа… меня бесило что она постоянно толстуху обижала. Ну типа….  Ну бл. Не приязнь к ней у меня. А так, из прикольных, это Бомбата, который люто забомбил в мини подлодке. Макс, и вы не подумайте, я посчитал прикольным картину в его комнате. Он собрал портрет из десятков кусков рисунка. Что…. Ну интересно. Так же чудила, тоже забавный чел. Ну и Аня хоть и она не является для меня особо интересной, в ней меня интересует только то, на сколько реально так делать будучи беременной, но я этого никогда не узнаю, а может и узнаю. Еще приколы с Вайтом есть, где он обдалбывается клубникой и бегает по космосу. Забавно че….. больше никто не запомнился. Но и этого круга хватит. 

[h1][b]Мир[/b][/h1]
Вся игра состоит из уровней, каждый достаточно хорошо проработан. Стилистически красив, и истетично уникален. Будь то Манхетен после ядерки, или Венера в космосе, или дом Бласковеца, с флешбеками, или атомный бункер. Все истетично, красиво и приятно глазу. Графон в целом очень красивый, мне очень понравилось. Отдельное слово спец эффектам, взрывам и огню. Миссия в Новом Орлеане на Панцерхунде просто шик, такой красивый огонь, взрывы машин, взрывы рюкзаков супер-солдат, просто песня. Еще в игре есть коллекционные предметы, по типу записок, которые раскрывают мир еще лучше, эскизы икей фото карточки, золото, карточки звезд, и они все как по мне отлично подчеркивают игру. Мне было интересно искать их на уровнях, параллельно кромсая фрицев, и слушая музон.

[h1][b]Геймплей[/b][/h1]
Геймплей можно описать 2 словами, кровавое месиво. Убийства в игре приятные, есть расчлиненка, много крови, отлетающие части брони. А музыка, ух. Музыка дает шарм, дает кайф убивать. 

Есть еще вариативность, можно по тихому, не шуметь и красться на цыпочках. Но в подобной игре, это не нужно. Ведь весь кайф в насилии. 

[h1][b]Оружие, навыки, прокачка[/b][/h1]
В игре есть пистолет, пп, автомат, дробовик, гранатомет, мини гранатомет, и каждое из них имеет 3 улучшения, в основном они нацелены на упрощение игры, по типу увеличенный магазин, прицел, глушитель или рикошет (Прикольная тема кста).Так же есть тяжелые пушки, по типу огнемета, лазергана, которые вносят сильный урон, но замедляю героя. Еще есть гранаты и топоры(Я их особо не использовал) Больше про оружие сказать толком не чего, потому что ну, это не самое главное.


Навыки, в игре есть прокачка, в которой тебе нужно выполнять определенные действия, по типу убивать в голову, или убивать в ближнем бою в бою или по стелсу. И даже если вы погибните, или загрузите сохранения, то прогресс не сброситься, что прикольно. За прокачку навыков открываются небольшие приятные возможности. По типу, при обнаружении замедляется время как в Metal Gear Solid, или позволяет нести больше топоров, уменьшает задержку перед взрывом и тд. Что не столь нужно, но если есть то почему бы и нет.

Проходя по сюжету, вы можете выбрать 1 из 3 улучшений(В будущем можно найти все 3), Сжимающий корсет, силовые скобы и ходули . И карта идеально проработана под эти устройства. На любой местности можно использовать любую из улучшений, где-то подняться на хадулях по выше, где то проползти  по узкому проему, где-то выдолбить стену что бы не повадно было, так же с помощью тарана можно сбивать врагов с ног, с помощью ходулей тактикульно перемещаться по карте и допустим, обойти с сзади.

[h1][b]Техническое состояние[/b][/h1]
Я обычно не говорю о состоянии игры, потому что может что у меня сломано у кого то починено. НО. Меня очень сильно потрепало то что игра очень часто вылетает, либо зависает. Я честно не знаю почему, ведь супер 4070 топ за свои деньги, но даже она не тянет. Крч. Приплыли.

[h1][b]Про провал продаж[/b][/h1]
Недавно я наткнулся на видео StopGame, про серию  Wolfenstein. А именно «История провала Wolfenstein». И знаете. Мне стало очень грустно. Ведь я узнал что случилось с следующей частью, и это печально. Я думаю, что скорее всего больше новых вульфинштейнов не будет, и история не закончится…. Всем реально советую посмотреть видео. Мне было очень интересно смотреть, и я сделал для себя некие выводы, но они не имеют отношения к обзору. Просто хотелось затронуть этот момент.

[h1][b]Итоговое мнение[/b][/h1]
Wolfenstein серия подарившая мне много приятных ощущений и воспоминаний. Очень грустно что она погибла. Но стоит встать и идти дальше. Ведь жизнь идет. И не стоит останавливаться. Всем советую поиграть. Реально годный продукт. Если бы я ставил оценку от 1 до 10 (Где 10 не существует, 9 это шедевр который покорил всех) то я бы поставил честные 8, твердые, уверенные, кровавые 8 баллов. Обязательно ставьте лайки, это меня мотивирует жить и двигаться дальше, так же подписывайтесь на профиль в steam мне будет очень приятно, и пишите свое мнение, мне будет очень интересно его почитать. Всем удачи.

184149565.review:
«Никто не остановит Бласковица, кроме плохих сохранений!»

Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus — это настоящая мясорубка альтернативной истории, в которой Америка оккупирована нацистами. Главный герой, Би-Джей Бласковиц, вооружается до зубов, чтобы снова спасать мир. Игра сочетает безумие перестрелок, драматичный сюжет и щепотку американского патриотизма.

---

Плюсы:

1. **Сюжет с эмоциями и абсурдом**  
   Убивать нацистов, безусловно, весело, но сюжет захватывает не только экшеном. Это трогательная история сопротивления и человечности с эпичными поворотами — от ностальгии до дикой сатиры.    

2. **Шикарные персонажи**  
   Главные герои запоминаются: от тяжёлого на характер Бласковица до харизматичной Аня и абсолютно нелепых второстепенных персонажей. Эта компания борцов за свободу сделает игру живой.  

3. **Боевая система**  
   Динамичные перестрелки, возможность использовать два оружия одновременно и стильные добивания заставляют чувствовать себя непобедимым! Лучшая стратегия? «Беги и стреляй», что добавляет адреналина.  

4. **Графика и дизайн мира**  
   В альтернативной Америке 1960-х, захваченной нацистами, отчётливо видны детали — пропаганда, переосмысленные культурные символы. И всё это выглядит отлично, благодаря качественным текстурам и красивым локациям.  

5. **Черный юмор**  
   Подкалывать нацистов и перемалывать их через зубы американского гранатомёта всегда с приправой чёрного юмора. Диалоги тоже нередко заставляют улыбнуться.  

---

Минусы:

1. **Перегруженная сложность**  
   Даже на обычной сложности враги стреляют как профессиональные киберспортсмены, что заставляет частенько перегружать чекпойнты. Любителям «попроще» может быстро стать тяжело.  

2. **Нелогичная система сохранений**  
   Иногда автоматические сохранения происходят в таких местах, где вы остаетесь почти без здоровья и окружены врагами. Ощущение справедливости? Нет, не слышали.  

3. **Монотонность в перестрелках**  
   Через несколько часов динамика боёв может показаться однообразной. Да, две пушки в руках — это круто, но на десятой миссии может захотеться чего-то нового.  

4. **Требовательность к системе**  
   Если у вас не топовый ПК, возможны падения FPS и редкие баги. Консольная версия тоже местами проседает, что может портить впечатление.  

5. **Небольшие стелс-проблемы**  
   Попытки пройти уровни скрытно иногда кажутся бессмысленными, потому что игра намного больше поощряет подход «всё разнести».  

---

Мораль истории:  
Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus напоминает нам, что бороться за свободу и свои убеждения нужно до конца, даже если ситуация кажется безнадёжной. Главное, не бояться зла, будь то в реальной жизни или альтернативных историях. Правда, этот урок надо брать с долей осторожности — ведь нельзя всё решить двойным дробовиком в реальности (жаль, правда?).  

**Итог:**  
Wolfenstein II — это смесь безумного экшена и глубокого сюжета. Игра несёт атмосферу борьбы и противостояния. Это один из тех шутеров, которые будут держать вас в напряжении и веселье. **Оценка: 8/10.** Сильная игра, которая балансирует между эпиком и сумасшествием.

183998966.review:
Wolfenstein: The New Order played everything, from a yiddish ancient civilization with advanced tech, to super soldier Nazis taking over the world, straight. It was serious, it was dark, and you got the feeling that you were fighting a war that was long lost. It was well written, well acted, and took it's silly subject material seriously. The labor camp scene in particular was striking, it was powerful, and just like the villains of the game, it was played off so banal and common it's terrifying.

And that is what really sells it, it's all so mundane, the way the Nazis act is mundane, the way the villains act is mundane, everything, the cruelty and horror of the Nazi regime is that the people in charge did such unspeakable horrors and did it with the ease and the same demeanor that one breathes.

The committed acts of unspeakable horror, and felt nothing. Nazism is and forever shall be the altar of ultimate evil.

Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus is a fucking joke compared to TNO, it's filled with hamfisted modern political allegories, character feel more at home in a Quentin Tarantino Blaxploitation Grindhouse B movie than in a serious commentary on the horror of Fascism.

It's filled with marvel humor to break the tension, constant fart, puke, shit, and piss jokes. And unironically has a scene where a heavily pregnant woman who is topless and covered in blood and entrails wields two machine guns against a horde of Nazi's.

It is a shameful mess of a game, that spits of the serious well written commentary of the previous entry. 

It is not worth your time and effort, whatever team wrote this monstrosity needs to go back and look at what made TNO such an amazing game.

Go play The New Order, it's a much more genuine, down to earth, serious, heartbreaking portrayal of a world where the light of freedom has been extinguished, and the most despicable regime to ever scar the face of the earth, waves it's banner from every rooftop. A game where you play as a man that wants to die, to be at peace, who is plagued by nightmares of a life he wish he could have lived, of lives he couldn't save. A game where BJ knows he will die, he will never know that peace until his duty is finished. A game where the inner monologue of BJ is him coming to terms with the life he's lived, his past, his present, and his future. A game where the oppressive nature of the environment is as much of a character as any other.

Go play The New Order.

183900982.review:
Bigger, badder, and more violent.  Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus is an excellent sequel to an already impressive original.  BJ is back to kill more Nazis but this time, Machinegames has taken a step back and pumped way more soul into the story.  It can be dark, it can be hopeless but at the same time, there's a great deal of humor both in the foreground and the background of the cutscenes - my personal favorite takes place in the first level - BJ and Set having a rather mundane conversation about their circumstances but, in the background, Nazis literally exploding due to booby traps Set placed to prevent incursion.  Other reviews have voiced concerns that the tone of the game is mixed - I'd agree but at the same time, I almost feel like this game would fit easily into a Tarantino universe.  Extreme violence mixed with a great deal of humanity.

In regards to gameplay, it's way more fluid and fast.  I love that they kept Perks system to level up as well as your ability to upgrade weapons.  This game is far easier to access than its predecessor which makes the game far more entertaining.

Graphics are top notch, you can definitely tell that this is the Id Tech Engine at its finest.  Levels are beautifully textured, decorated, and arranged.  And there is a huge variety of environments to visit.

Finally, sound, wow - the audio in this game is exceptional.  The music is fantastic.  There are moments, especially in the later levels where I just want to sit and take it all in.  I can definitely tell this had some Doom blood in it - very atmospheric.

The only area that I can knock this game on are the side missions.  I'm a big fan of side quests but the way in which this game held me, the player back, until 75% of the game was frustrating.  Parts of the game unlock with time/progression.  I didn't even realize Engima code machine was available to unlock levels until the bitter end and I didn't even realize I was at the end of the game until I found the credits rolling :/

Wolfenstein: The New Colossus is a great game, I cannot recommend it more - just pay attention to side quests as, before you know it, the game will be over :P  Fortunately, you can still go back and complete all those side missions, even once the game is done.

Enjoy!

[h1] Introduction [/h1]
Okay, all my gameplays of previous parts were made especially for this moment, for this game. I can’t call myself as a fan of Wolfenstein, and I definitely not the fan of this game, but I am a fan of games with good plots.

[h1] Main plot [/h1]
This game is a direct sequel of [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/n-flanders/recommended/201810/]Wolfenstein the New Order (review of which have been earlier)[/url]. And it starts exactly since the moment where previous part ended. As this game was last good Wolfenstein I don’t want to spoiler it. That’s why I may say - even today it’s one of the best plot game I have played.

I wanted to see two scenes which I have seen in YouTube earlier. [spoiler]One is in US with strawberry smoothie, and another one - with Hitler[/spoiler]. And when I was playing - it was even better then I have seen in YouTube videos.

[h1] Gameplay and Visuals [/h1]
Gameplay copies the previous parts. It’s the same fun Wolfenstein with all same mechanics. But Visuals - that’s where the most interesting thing is.
The game was released in 2017, and even today it looks great. The visuals comparing even to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/n-flanders/recommended/350080/]Old Blood (which was released two years earlier)[/url] - is much-much better.

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
I can’t say much more about this game. That’s a great Wolfenstein, with the same fun, but better in all senses. If you want to play a good visual game with great plot - Wolfenstein 2 should be definitely your choice.

Simultaneously one of the best and worst games I have ever played.

It's generally unpolished in all areas, with plenty of problems that, in my opinion, were easily fixable (game crashes, balancing woes, inconsistent gameplay pacing and difficulty, certain scripted events, animation glitches, etc).
[spoiler]The Courthouse scene is total bs because it's the hardest level in the game BY FAR, and you can "die" in this scene despite the whole thing being a dream.[/spoiler]

The story could have used more work, too. Many agree that Frau Engel is not an interesting villain, and most of the new characters are easily forgettable stand-ins that came off as a clearly failed attempt at good writing. And Grace is rude to everyone for no reason.

It's definitely not the worst thing ever, and I personally like it enough for what it is, but it has very real flaws. Most people have better games to play, anyway, like DOOM 2016, which Wolf 2 inherits many of its engine tools and assets from.

183610941.review:
[h1]Este es un gran caso de: «Lo recomendaría, pero… es decepcionante» [/h1]

Es una secuela un poco extraña, no es mala pero me gustaron mucho más los dos anteriores juegos de [b]Wolfenstein[/b], tanto [b]The New Order[/b] como [b]The Old Blood[/b]. Se toma la libertad de poner momentos todavía más exagerados que la entrega pasada perdiendo por momentos un poco la seriedad, aunque por otra parte; ahora sabemos más de la infancia complicada que tuvo [b]Blazkowicz[/b], ya que vemos los recuerdos que profundizan más en la psique del personaje como bien venían haciendo en las otras dos entregas. Eso sumado a que muestran más de lo que fue de [b]Estados Unidos[/b] luego del avance del [b]Reich fascista[/b], tenemos momentos como Manhattan en ruinas por una explosión nuclear y ver al [b]KKK[/b] estrechando lasos con los soldados de la [b]Alemania Nazi[/b], algo bastante distópico y terrorífico de ver.

Incluso aparece [spoiler]Hitler[/spoiler]

El nivel final es anticlimático tanto en jugabilidad como trama, esperaba algo más… No sé, cualquier otra cosa que no sea repetir escenarios de los primeros niveles.

Tiene mejoras en la jugabilidad como poder deslizarnos si nos agachamos mientras corremos y las explosiones pueden tumbarnos al piso, un detalle que considero que esta bueno. Sigue estando esto de que la cobertura se va destruyendo a disparos o se derriten con armas que tengan rayo láser.

A veces es medio tosco lo de trepar algunas pendientes, hay lugares donde fácilmente el personaje podría subirse y no lo hace porque no es exactamente el sitio donde debe ir el jugador, se siente como que hay varias paredes invisibles, en especial si usamos los zancos.

Pusieron misiones secundarias donde revisitamos distritos (y por lo tanto; los mismos niveles que ya jugamos) en donde tenemos que acabar con el objetivo marcado, estos niveles se desbloquean tras un minijuego a cambio de puntos que se consiguen en los cuerpos de los comandantes que matemos y la verdad es que no sé porque agregaron algo tan soso al juego que se siente como relleno, más porque ni siquiera le pusieron puntos de control, si perdes te toca hacer toda la misión opcional de nuevo, por suerte son cortas y se pueden hacer deprisa, muchos dirán que esto lo hicieron apropósito para darle un desafío extra, para mí no pusieron puntos de control por vagos nomás porque el guardado manual está disponible.

También tiene DLCs con algunos niveles extras pero ya la verdad es que no me interesa seguir jugándolo después de haberme dado vuelta la misión principal, me paso lo mismo que el [b]Dead Rising 3[/b], tiene contenido extra pero yo paso de jugarlo.

El juego empieza muy complicado con la vida limitada a 50, incluso habiéndomelo terminado [b]The New Order[/b] y [b]The Old Blood[/b] en dificultad [b]Über[/b], la secuela se siente insufriblemente injusta en dificultades más altas, no sé quién tuvo la brillante idea de limitar la salud a 50 con enemigos que hacen entre 5 y 12 de daño más o menos, por suerte hay muchos botiquines y la armadura si te tomas unos segundos vas a encontrar en cada esquina y en el caso de blindaje que tira el enemigo se agarra automáticamente. Si bien tenemos 50 de salud, podemos alcanzar 200 de armadura y tenes la sobresalud que queramos (la cual va bajando temporalmente), aunque para mí no lo compensa.

Después nos dan el clásico 100 de vida y 100 de armadura sumado a una de tres opciones, una de sigilo, una que nos deja alcanzar sitios más alto y una embestida, ¿Les soy honesto? Entiendo que querían dar más rejugabilidad en plan jugar con cada una en tus partidas, pero prefiero que me dejen usar los tres aumentos.

El sigilo sigue siendo igual, no cambiaron nada.

[u]En resumen:[/u] La jugabilidad es más de lo mismo pero sin poner muchas más cosas que lo vuelvan realmente una evolución, por no decir que lo poco nuevo que tiene se siente que se podía hacer mejor.

El juego tiene doblaje latino pero no en su versión de [b]Steam[/b], acá solo hay doblaje en Español de España, que igual si bien me fui acostumbrando, por lo que vi mientras jugaba y por lo que vi en videos en el caso del doblaje latino… la verdad es que las actuaciones dejan mucho que desear en ambos doblajes, pero por lo menos son decentes.

Algunas opciones graficas que cambiaba me tiraba “crash dump” o algo así, también cuando lo cerraba, medio inestable el juego, curiosamente algo parecido a [b]Dishonored 2[/b], aunque usan distintos engines ambos salieron más o menos en la misma época por [b]Bethesda[/b] y tiene cerradas abruptas que nunca fueron arregladas. También me tiro varias veces que mi placa de video no tiene suficiente memoria pese a que supero lo recomendado y puedo jugar al máximo todo sin bajones de FPS.

Es más, como dije en mi video hablando sobre [b]Wolfenstein: The New Order[/b], aumentar el campo de visión glitchea ciertas cosas, lo que me da risa es que no solo no lo arreglaron, sino que aparecen carteles advirtiéndote de esta decisión, es decir, los que hicieron el juego tiraron la de «Sabemos que esto está mal hecho, ¡Y aun así no lo vamos arreglar!»

A duras penas lo podría recomendar y creo que sería más que nada por ciertos momentos de la trama.

183534562.review:
It's my 88th review on Steam, and in honor of that being one of the two most important digits in Nazi numerology, I figured that the game I reviewed had to be one where you can stomp Adolf Hitler's head until he dies.

Unfortunately, [i]Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus[/i] isn't the blindside reboot that its predecessor [i]Wolfenstein: The New Order[/i] is, nor the love letter to retro gaming that prequel [i]Wolfenstein: The Old Blood[/i] is. It's the beginning of a downward trend that continued in [i]Youngblood[/i], but [i]New Colossus[/i] still has high points that outnumber its low points.  To dig into why I'm only mildly positive on this title, let's examine [i]New Colossus[/i] as a sequel to [i]New Order[/i], as a work of exploitation fiction, and as a work of earnest political commentary.

[h1][i]New Colossus[/i] as a sequel to [i]New Order[/i][/h1]
On the face of it, [i]New Colossus[/i] excels as a sequel, albeit it's a 'more of what you love' kind of sequel. In his endless battle against the Nazis of this dystopian alternate timeline, protagonist William "BJ" Blazkowicz uses the exact same arsenal of weapons he used in [i]New Order[/i] and [i]Old Blood[/i] to fight the exact same roster of enemies that he fought in [i]New Order[/i] and [i]Old Blood[/i], albeit both BJ and the enemies are equipped with a few minor new gimmicks to shake things up a little. The wheel is not reinvented here: instead, MachineGames really focuses on what makes a Wolfenstein-Reboot combat encounter work, and they've polished the retro-corridor-shooter game loop of their franchise to a spit-shine here. Compared to combat encounters in the prior two games, encounters here are more varied, shooting galleries flow better, and the fights are both more fun and more challenging (with those two often informing each other).

However, I'd mentioned that the game is a "retro corridor shooter," like the entire franchise before it, and that belies one of its greatest problems: level diversity. You see, the plot of the game concerns BJ returning to an occupied America to help liberate it from the Nazi oppressors, but for the sake of the gameplay loop, this America -- one of the largest nations on Earth, with incredible open spaces and biome diversity -- needs to be an America comprised exclusively of corridors.  Therefore, the game fails to fully explore what a post-nuclear Manhattan wasteland looks like, because the Manhattan levels are spent in the corridors of its subway system. The game fails to explore what a Nazi-occupied New Mexico looks like, because after five minutes of walking a single city block of Roswell, BJ must descend into a military base to shoot through [b]those corridors.[/b] A guerrilla uprising in New Orleans is perceived near-entirely from -- you guessed it -- the corridors of its sewer system.  For a sequel that promised extremely evocative, [i]Man in the High Castle[/i]-esque imagery of a Nazi-occupied America, the game actually has very few artistically memorable combat arenas.

[i]Doom[/i] could get away with this because its Mars base setting is simply a convenient location for video game violence to occur, but it's a weird match for this [i]Wolfenstein[/i] reboot-sequel, which clearly has cinematic aspirations.

[h1][i]New Colossus[/i] as a Grindhouse Movie[/h1]
...Which brings us nicely into the weird push-and-pull at the core of this sequel, which seems to demand to be taken seriously as a commentary on fascism and white supremacy, while also being a very intentional homage to grindhouse cinema.

To be clear, all of the MachineGames [i]Wolfensteins[/i] aspire to be exploitation fiction. [i]Wolfenstein: the New Order[/i] owes a great debt to Tarantino's [i]Inglorious Basterds[/i] and classic works of Nazi exploitation like [i]Ilsa: She-Wolf of the SS[/i]: movies that make titillation of the violence of the Nazi regime. [i]Old Blood[/i] embraced the 1930s serial mood, placing itself squarely in the canon of contemporary Nazi-fightin' genre tributes like [i]Hellboy[/i] and [i]Indiana Jones[/i].  By contrast, this game's 1960s counterculture setting -- albeit an alt-history one that pits iconic American counterculture figures like the Black Panthers and Hippies against the Nazis -- pulls liberally from the canon of blaxploitation, drugsploitation, sexploitation, and more, and these aren't all easy marriages with the Nazi-exploitation genre that the prior two games embodied.

It's hard to articulate, but [i]The New Colossus[/i] is the first game in the series to feel [i]sleazy[/i], in a way that MachineGames was clearly deliberately shooting for but which sometimes steps over the boundaries of good taste in a way that feels edgy for edginess' sake.  Be it black panthers shooting Nazis while crowing about these jive-ass Nazi crackers, or a recurring subplot about how pregnancy hormones are causing BJ's wife Anya to experience sexual pleasure when she shoots Nazis (ultimately culminating in a [i]Shoot Em' Up[/i] style sex-scene-that-is-also-a-gunfight where she multiple-orgasms after pulping seven men with a grenade) the tone of the story feels gratuitous in a way that dulls, rather than sharpens, the edge of its commentary.

[h1][i]New Colossus[/i] as a Work of Commentary[/h1]
This is a problem because [i]Wolfenstein[/i] doesn't exist in a cultural vacuum, especially not [i]New Colossus[/i].  Let's not mince words about it: [i]New Colossus[/i] is the first post-Charlottesville [i]Wolfenstein[/i] title, and the game's marketers played that for everything it was worth to draw deliberate parallels between its in-game sci-fi Nazis and the ugly, resurgent, and suddenly mainstream American white nationalist movement. [i]Wolfenstein: The New Colossus[/i] intentionally inserted itself in a national dialogue, knowing that like Keurig and Nike before them, they could poke the nest of the very worst Americans by making a big dumb show about this game being about Strong Black People Killing Whitey. Predictably, the most fragile egos on the internet came screaming and blubbering to give the game months of free publicity.

I'm, of course, burying the lede here: the obvious question that follows is "so, it's a work of political commentary, right?"

The answer is that no, it really isn't. The most revolutionary that [i]New Colossus[/i] ever gets is tepidly pointing out that white and especially German-descended Americans actually broadly supported the Nazis and that resistance against fascist regimes has always historically come first from communists and minorities, which the game milks for cheap horror; in the Roswell level that is our only encounter with "ordinary" white Americans, they are mewling Nazi toadies, given no characterization beyond "abominably racist."

It's commentary, certainly, but it's facile commentary, and sits poorly with the fact that the story also demands that we see the liberation of these cartoonish bigots as laudable, or even something that they'd want. The finale, where our multiracial, communist hero team go on television and wake up America with a rousing call-to-action, feels unearned because we have seen only bigotry and ugliness, not an America that desires or deserves to be liberated.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
[i]The New Colossus[/i] is the [i]Wolfenstein[/i] for our times: a big, bombastic, flashy work of genre fiction that often threatens to have a point beyond just being rip-roaring violent fun, but which then trips over its own dick trying to make it. [i]New Colossus[/i] enjoys a much-debated spot in the contemporary Gamer Culture Wars that it absolutely is neither good nor [b]bad[/b] enough to deserve. At once ambitious and complacent, filmic and gamey, too political but yet [b]not[/b] political, it defines the "mid," 7/10 first-person shooter.  A good on-sale title.

183528235.review: If you can tolerate the occasional over the top or tone deaf cut scene this game does provide some of the most satisfying shooting of any FPS I have played. The weapons are powerful, in addition to looking and sounding phenomenal. Enemies provide great feedback to being shot with armor as well as gore and body parts flying off as they take damage. The visual design and variety of the enemies is also praise worthy. Controls are snappy and responsive it has truly never felt better to control B.J. Strong recommend to fans of FPS especially those that are looking for a challenge on higher difficulty settings.
